title: What to do With Left-Over Hextech Crafting Items?
body:
So I bought all three project chests as well as the disruption chest and received a total of 5 augmented cache fragments... What is the point of only being able to receive 5 of them when it requires 3 to make one and 6 to make 2? Why do we have these left-over pieces?

Also, what will happen to the project cores that we didn't have enough to spend on something or we spent all we could and now have extra? 

These left-over crafting parts leave me feeling kind of gypped, and I'm sure it's the same for other people. There is nothing to do with them: we can't disenchant them, so they feel like useless clutter.

A nice feature to be added would be at the end of the event, all project materials from the event (project cores, augmented cache fragments, etc.) would have the option to be disenchanted into either essence, or perhaps you could combine 3-4 project items to get a Hextech chest. This would make players feel more fulfilled because there would finally be a point to all the extra, useless items in their Hextech crafting inventory.

Riot, if you have an answer to my questions, I would appreciate an explanation. If everything I recommended makes sense, please take what I said into consideration.

Thanks for your time,
MolotovPeep

replies.body: I can't seem to disenchant these :(
It's going to happen in the future, I believe.

Extra fragments were available in case you were able to nab fragments from Augment Caches.  The current plan is to have leftover project disruption materials be disenchantable.  Information on this is also provided in our [project disruption guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/210155266-PROJECT-DISRUPTION-FAQ).  Hopefully that helps clear things up, and put you at ease!
Thank you for the response, that's very helpful!
I wouldn't mind if they even let us use them as Key Fragments, or even just let us disenchant them into blue or orange essence.
